Detailed Description

During the execution of a pairing request by the Bluetooth Stack a request for authentication will be sent to the Local Bluetooth Device, no matter wheter the Local or the Remote Bluetooth Device has initiated the pairing request. To answer the recieved request for authentication the application programmer has to instantiate a BtSendPasskeyReqeust, set wheter the pairing is accepted or not. If the pairing is accepted the pin code must be set. After a positive execution of this request the Bluetooth Stack has created the link keys, which will be used for further authentication and encryption.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN BtSendPasskeyRequest::Execute (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Sumbit this request to the Bluetooth Stack.

Execute instructs this request to send itself to the Bluetooth Stack for execution purposes.
In the base class of all Bluetooth Requests - BtRequest - there is an interface defined, that all requests must fullfill respectively implement. Some functions in this interface are declared pure virtual because they can not be implemented in the base classes. Execute is one of these functions.Because the execution of various requests differ very strong, the implmentation of this function is done by the various concrete request classes.

Returns:
TRUE: The setup of the stack parameters was successfull and the Bluetooth stack accepted the requested operation.
FALSE: Either the setup of the stack parameters failed or the Bluetooth stack rejected the requested operation.

Implements BtRequest.

BOOLEAN BtSendPasskeyRequest::GetAcceptPairing (   )  const
 

Will the received pairing request be accepted or not.

GetAcceptPairing returns whether this request will accept the requested pairing or reject it, when this request is exectued.

Returns:
TRUE: The requested pairing will be accepted.
FALSE: The requested pairing will be rejected.

const WString & BtSendPasskeyRequest::GetPinCode (   )  const
 

Gets the pin code.

GetPinCode returns the pin code that will be submitted when this request is executed.

Returns:
A reference to a WString representing the pin code as an unicode string.

BtRequestType BtSendPasskeyRequest::GetRequestType (   )  const [virtual]
 

Get type of this request.

The runtime type information feature is not supported by all compilers which this framework is used with. So a rudimentary type information system is implemnted by this class. Each type of request that has no subtypes (leaf class) must return an unique type identifier. GetRuestType return this type idenifier which is implemented as an enumeration type.

Returns:
A BtRequestType containing the type that describes this request.

Implements BtRequest.

BOOLEAN BtSendPasskeyRequest::OnMessage (  const Message &  message  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Message dispatching member function.

The OnMessage member function is the first entry point in every dispatcher for the reception of messages. From there on it will be routed to the appropriate On... member function, if it should be handled by this dispatcher or passed back to the superior dispatcher.

Returns:
TRUE: The received message has be handle. No further handling for the message is needed.
FALSE: The received message is not handled by this dispatcher. Route it forward to the next dispatcher.

Implements BtLocalRequest.

void BtSendPasskeyRequest::RegisterMessages (   )  const [protected, virtual]
 

Register the required messages for receipt.

After registering itself at an application, the request has to tell the message dispatching mechanism which messages this request is intersted in. RegisterMessage performs this task. For the BtSendPasskeyRequest the following message is registered: BtSendPasskeyMessage

Reimplemented from UserDispatcher.

void BtSendPasskeyRequest::SetAcceptPairing (  BOOLEAN  accept_pairing  ) 
 

Sets whether the received pairing request will be accepted or not.

SetAcceptPairing sets wheter this request will accept the requested pairing or reject it, when this request is executed.

Parameters:
accept_pairing A BOOLEAN containing whether to accept or reject the requested pairing.

void BtSendPasskeyRequest::SetPinCode (  const WString &  pin_code  ) 
 

Sets the pin code.

SetPinCode sets the pin code that will be submitted when this request is executed.

Parameters:
pin_code A reference to WString representing the pin code that has to be submitted a an unicode string.

void BtSendPasskeyRequest::UnregisterMessages (   )  const [protected, virtual]
 

Unregister the required messages from receipt.

Before unregistering itself from the application, the request has to remove the messages, it is interested in form the message dispatching mechanism. UnregisterMessage performs this task. For the BtSendPasskeyRequest the following message is unregistered: BtSendPasskeyMessage

Reimplemented from UserDispatcher.
